website_summaries.verdict: Convenient features for a value price. The top choice for budget-conscious campers who don't want to sacrifice comfort or quality.
pros: A basic model that stands out for its ability to self-inflate
Users love the lightweight design and waterproof cover
cons: Occasionally requires additional inflation after several hours of use
Care must be taken not to puncture it when inflated

customer_reviews.title: beware: pillow is useless but is part of the length
customer_reviews.text: The pad itself seems well constructed and decently thick. The pillow is uncomfortable at any level of inflation, and be warned that it is counted in the length, so the best way to use the pad is probably to inflate the pillow slightly and then turn it around so it is at your feet rather than your head. Would have been better to leave off the pillow or add extra pad instead.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: It's super easy to inflate
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were simple and clear and it's packaged very well... It's super easy to inflate. It took a more that a few minutes for it to completely inflate and you do have to blow up the pillow section but once inflated it was very firm and comfortable. Overall very,very nice,and super comfortable. Works very well for sleepovers too :) Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Robert O

customer_reviews.title: Great sleep mat
customer_reviews.text: This is really neat for those who don't need a lot of padding under their sleeping bag. I bought this for my granddaughter for sleepovers. It's easy to inflate - just open the valve and it does it itself. Close the valve until ready to deflate - then open valve, fold in half, and roll up tightly (deflate pillow as well), and then use straps to hold together to put in the included bag. Nice and small package for traveling!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Williams

customer_reviews.title: Not your pillow top mattress at home but it surficed
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping mat was ok when I used these for the first time on a tenting trip. The mat did self inflate but I found it better to allow them to self inflate as much as they could on their own then I did manually blow air into it to give a little more cushion. They are not like sleeping on a pillow top mattress bed but I would say they are better then sleeping on the plain ground. I did purchase two and used the provided snaps to attach them together. The mat did deflate easily to repack into the storage bag.
customer_reviews.author: M. McPhee

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable compared to other hiking mats
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a backpacking trip with my girlfriend. This was perfect because we also purchased a double sleeping bag and this pad was the perfect size! very luxurious compared to other hiking pads, it is very comfortable and even has little inflatable pillows! with that being said, beware of the size. It was a lot larger compared to other sleeping pads and didn't fit in my pack so I strapped it on to the outside (pictured). But the benefits of having such a comfortable sleeping pad was worth the extra size.
customer_reviews.author: Niles Getz

customer_reviews.title: very high quality cost ratio
customer_reviews.text: my son got a super nice Inflating Camping Sleeping Pads, but three times more expensive and a little bit lighter. I am pretty happy with this one. it has a high quality reliable material to inflate well, hold the pressure, and feel comfortable. the pillow is convenient as well. note that i have an average height. the pad is a little bit short placing my heels outside of the pad. I feel comfortable that way since i use it on a SUV floor. pay attention if you are tall or use it against a freezing cold floor.
customer_reviews.author: Denis W.

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: I liked these pads, but did use as a second layer with a large pad underneath it. Easy to inflate and deflate and get back into the bags. Set up three different camp sites and was a pro by the last day.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Jo

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: We bought the twin size 2person sleeping pad and it’s alright. The pillow isn’t very comfortable but that’s ok. Opened all of the air valves to self inflate and realized that u have to manually blow air into it to fully inflate. Even after all that, it’s not very cushioning about 1” which is ok but not as it’s advertised. It feels less dense than its single-pad counterpart which we also own. U quickly feel the pressure points. If you’re car camping try to get a 3”
customer_reviews.author: Ken M.

customer_reviews.title: Deflated some. Sucky pillow
customer_reviews.text: The pillow is pointless unless you want to strain your neck all night. I blew it up about half way and woke up in the middle of the night to my ear being sore so I just used a different pillow. The pad is good. It kinda deflated a little bit each night I've used it, however it is semi soft on it's own so even if it deflated all the way it wasn't the worst thing in the world. All and all it did the job but I was ready to sleep in a real bed again after a few days on it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Myers

customer_reviews.title: Much easier than blowing up an air mattress.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after having some horrible nights sleep camping last summer due to deflating air mattresses. I wanted something that wasn't going to pop or get a hole in it and leak out air over night. This was surprisingly comfortable, and my fiance didn't seem to complain about it either, which is a plus! It wraps up nicely, and that is a huge plus for me. Looking forward to using it again.
customer_reviews.author: HGS

customer_reviews.title: Good but large footprint
customer_reviews.text: The mat is great. Takes a bit of time to get to max inflation. The only issue I have is that it is quite large when folded. It isn't heavy, just a bit bulky. I bought an inflatable one that's gets to the size of a soda can when put away vs this one that is about the size of a big nacho cheese can. Otherwise it is easier to fold and put away because you can snap the buttons together to hold it in shape while you roll it up. The inflatable one gets all crazy and slides around so it's hard to get a tight roll without rerolling several times.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for car camping
customer_reviews.text: Bought it so the wife and i could go camping and was suprized on how well it performed. it fits me and my wife perfectly (im 6ft) it had just enough inflation to keep us off the ground and dry. exactly what I wanted. its just two individual foam pads glued together but they are seperated into two air chambers. so you can fold them ontop of each other if you want a lush single person camping experiance. was easy to deflate and roll back into the bag. kinda big for a backpack but perfect for car camping.
customer_reviews.author: Garth Devlin

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool idea but this thing sucks
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool idea but this thing sucks. The valve for the pillow will poke your eye while you are sleeping and it pops out a lot so you wake up to a deflated pillow. Adjusted the level of air multiple times and could not get it to where it was comfortable. Also sleeping bags are polyester as well so this makes for a slick surface. Found myself having slid off the dam thing like 30 times. Made for a very long uncomfortable night. Stick with the foam pads.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: love the functionality and ease of use
customer_reviews.text: love the functionality and ease of use. however, i found it super uncomfortable to sleep on. for reference, i used it under my sleeping bag in a tent. it felt just like i was sleeping on the hard ground. was hoping this pad would provide a little cushion. I should add that my husband loves the pads and he would rate it 5 stars. All depends on your sleeping preference.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!  Well worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: While this mat is very thin, while inflated it offers a ton of comfort, even if you lay on your side! Not to mention, it's a great barrier between you and the ground for the colder nights. The mat has snaps going down each side that I was able to use to snap onto my U.S.G.I Modular Sleep System to ensure you are always on top of the mat even if you toss and turn during the night. Great quality. Update: No longer holds air. Useless. Didnt even use it that many times.
customer_reviews.author: Youhozz

customer_reviews.title: Best sleeping pad
customer_reviews.text: Used this for the first time last night camping and man i was impressed. I slept on my back and sides and it was comfortable all around I did sleep on sand which made it better. The built in pillow is great I adjusted it to how I wanted it and I got really good sleep 5 star product you won't be let down. I am 5'4 180lbs I slept great but I'm sure anyone will. Probably the biggest thing I carried on my hiking backpack but it's not heavy just a tad bit big but I'm not complaining comfort is key, highly recommend this oh yeah and it's very easy to inflate. 🤙
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro

customer_reviews.title: Check it immediately for flaws
customer_reviews.text: Ordered as a birthday gift for my son who us in Boy Scouts. Used it once in backyard a d it deflated through the night. I thought maybe he didn't tighten the valve. Tried a 2nd night and same thing. Found the seal around the valve was leaking. Unfortunately the return date was exceeded by 7 days. Try it out immediately when you get it, even if saving as a gift for someone.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Beat out the air mattress
customer_reviews.text: Bought 4 of these for my husband and sons for camping. They self-inflate well, and an extra puff or two of air makes them perfect. These are about an inch thick when fully inflated and were more successful at minimizing ridges and roots on the ground than my air mattress that was over 3 inches thick.
customer_reviews.author: Sealpup Mama

customer_reviews.title: The pillow is a plus but you can leave it out if you don't like the air pillow feel
customer_reviews.text: Takes a couple minutes to self inflate into an inch thick or so, you can also blow into the valve to increase firmness, but I think there is only till certain point you can blow before hearing from cracking sounds. Planning to add this to camping cot. The pillow is a plus but you can leave it out if you don't like the air pillow feel.
customer_reviews.author: Chang

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: This is SO UNCOMFORTABLE. I literally took a knife to it after I was done camping because I didn’t even want to take it home with me.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Snowdon

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but slippery
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty comfortable and easy to inflate/deflate. The pillow has to be blown up manually, which isn’t a deal breaker. The only beef I have is that they are super slippery with a nylon sleeping bag on top of them. It’s like a banana peel on an ice rink.
customer_reviews.author: adRAD

customer_reviews.title: Pillow is uncomfortable, width is to narrow for the average American size.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to inflate mat, difficult to deflate. Pillow is uncomfortable and hard to inflate and deflate. Very narrow, more for a skinny person. For larger people, with the provided snaps, This would be more comfortable if you had four, two snapped side by side, or one ontop of the other.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Perrigin

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son, his comment: "Haven't gotten to use it for camping as yet, but expect it to be comfortable when I do finally get to go." He did air it up and laid on it in the yard. The first one ordered leaked. Returning it was easy and ordered another to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Butterfly Lady

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with this mat/pad
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I am happy with this mat/pad, but it felt a bit uncomfortable sleeping on it during my second camping trip. However, I might not have given the pad enough time to inflate properly since I was tired after a long day of hiking and wanted to fall asleep quickly. I will update this review after my third camping trip, but so far, I like this product. It is compact and it was super easy to deflate.
customer_reviews.author: Rad

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointing
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited for this product and slept on it for two nights this summer and I was no better off than a yoga mat. My self inflating colemans offer far more cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Barela

customer_reviews.title: I bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: Great car camping... Maybe backpacking mat. As the headline says, I bought a second one. I'm notorious for forgetting my pillow... The built in one prevents me from having to sleep on a rock. I have two now and they snap together which is convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Quality mat
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the money! Nice mat, inflated to provide good support under the sleeping bag, compact, and it goes back into its carry bag without difficulty.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable extra padded sleeping pad for your camping trips
customer_reviews.text: great for that added comfort with that extra padding to sleep comfortably. Self inflating. Just open the nosel located at the foor of the pad and it does all the rest. You do have to blow up the pillow though. As for deflating you have to open nosel and roll the air out and then close the nosel again to keep it deflated while in storage. Aslo comes with a travel bag and elastic securing bands to keep it from unrolling before you are ready to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia George

customer_reviews.title: Lots of comfort under a sleeping bag in a small package (Great Dane approved!)

No ... not for sleeping ... these spoiled furkids like them for laying around outside the camper to make a soft spot to survey the camp site and people watch. We have used them for years when we tent camp and they are compact and really make a difference.
customer_reviews.author: real gypsy girl

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: My pre-teen uses this to camp with her troop and its been perfect for her. Its easy for her to roll out and easy for her to roll up and put it away.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry

The pillow and the mat are separated into two holes, so you can adjust the thickness of the pillow and the mat separately and this is so convenient. The pad is lightweight and easy to inflate. Perfect for hiking or a go bag. It held air and was fairly comfortable. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Ziqi

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I used the mat for camping trip in Utah and in Grand Canyon and I was really happy with it. When not inflated, it’s nice and compact, doesn’t take much space in the bag. When inflated, it’s comfortable to lay on even with my back issues. The cushion was quite firm, so I deflated it a bit and it was not a problem. It’s easy to pack it back after use. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice for car camping.
customer_reviews.text: Durable and well padded. Probably a bit heavy for back packing, but well made and packs nice. I got the inflatables pillow but would have probably preferred the one without. Air pillows just don't work for me. The snaps are nice for linking pads.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Kickert

customer_reviews.title: Started leaking on second use

customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: 270lbs and 5'11"
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 270lbs 5'11" man......and it is AMAZING slept very comfortable on the HARD FLOOR. The pillow does deflate a little but a neck pillow will solve that issue
customer_reviews.author: Jram179

customer_reviews.title: This is a simple and easy to use sleeping pad
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple and easy to use sleeping pad. Rolls up and fits back nicely into original bag. Not much for padding, but slightly softer than the floor/ground.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Worth buying if you limit on space and weight.
customer_reviews.text: It did work well especially for how small it is when rolled up it's perfect for when I'm using it for, I have a small boat and I can sleep at the bow of the boat and put a cover over myself it was exactly what I needed to keep me off the fiberglass and give me a little extra comfort .

customer_reviews.title: Keeps me warm at night !
customer_reviews.text: It actually works! Inflating the head part is the only thing that takes a bit of work, the rest is pretty easy.

customer_reviews.title: May be a good product.
customer_reviews.text: These sleeping mats seemed to be very durable, but, they were just too bulky for our needs.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable

My program does a lot of overnight stays where we have to sleep on the floor and I will definitely take this when I going camping. Worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Serves it's purpose.

customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Great backpacking pad for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Few trips so far, no issues, insulates well and surprising comfort. Pillow was best under inflated, you might say it has adjustable firmness.

I haven't had the opportunity to throw it on any type of rough terrain that would pose a picture hazard, however, it's been terrific to sleep on in a tent or on top of an Army cot. I *really* appreciate the pillow included. One less thing to ruck!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: In my 40’s a sleeping pad is much more important for backpacking trips. This is lightweight, packs reasonably small and is very comfortable. It self inflated to about 80%, and you have to blow the rest of the way. Deflating is also fairly quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition to my sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Perfect addition to my sleeping bag. It is easy to inflate/deflate and easy to stow away. it is light enough to attach to my hiking backpack without adding too much weight to it. I'm buying more for my camping buddies.

customer_reviews.title: Best sleep I've had camping in years!

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Sleeping Mat
customer_reviews.text: Tried this sleeping pad. Self-inflation works like magic. Just leave it for an hours or so it becomes pretty well inflated. If you want it to be firmer, just blow air in it to the firmness you desired. To test out the comfort level, I put a few Lego-duplo under the mat and could seldom feel it. But it is a small size sleeping mat which fits small adult or children.

customer_reviews.text: The sleeping pad did not really self-inflate. I had to manually inflate the pad and the pillow, but once I did, the pad was fairly comfortable. It also folds up and fits back into the bag with no problem.
